channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The Philippine virus that cost the world $10 billion
Singapore to begin to loosen virus restrictions
Pandemic experts issue sobering warning about future
item.description: Pandemic experts John Barry and Marc Lipsitch co-authored a new report predicting that the coronavirus pandemic could last up to two more years. They're warning that things could get "considerably worse than what we've seen so far."

item.title: White House blocks Fauci from testifying next week
He came home from hospital to die. His son found a way to keep him alive
item.description: When Suryakant "Suri" Nathwani returned from the hospital, the reserved 81-year-old grabbed his son's hand and pleaded to be allowed to die at home. "He said, 'Please promise me one thing: If I'm going to go, I'm going to go here. Do not take me back there,'" his son Raj Nathwani said.

item.title: Airbus A380: The wondrous giant that never quite took off
State media: Kim Jong Un made first public appearance in weeks
'This is pure folly': It's an insane time for Trump to pick (another) fight with China
item.description: President Donald Trump has picked the worst possible time to relaunch his trade battle with China.

item.title: CNN reporter reacts to new unverified photo of Kim Jong Un
item.description: North Korea claims that Kim Jong Un made a public appearance at a ribbon-cutting ceremony. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: Canada bans assault-style weapons after its worst ever mass murder
item.description: Assault-style weapons are banned in Canada effective immediately, the country's prime minister said Friday.

item.title: Hear meat worker's message to Trump after 4,900 test positive
item.description: Over 4,900 meat and poultry plant workers tested positive for coronavirus in the US, according to the CDC. CNN's Miguel Marquez speaks to a worker at a Tyson plant in Nebraska.

item.title: The 'tsunami' of airline job losses has begun in Europe. US carriers could be next.
Must-watch videos of the week
This was the most dangerous place in our planet's history
item.description: The world feels like a scary place these days, but a recently published paleontology study helps put things in perspective.

item.title: Biden denies ex-aide's sexual assault allegation: 'This never happened'
New White House press secretary vows not to lie, then misleads on Michael Flynn
item.description: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany promised at her first press briefing Friday that she will "never lie" but she did mislead in an answer about fired national security adviser Michael Flynn.

item.title: US health agency's top spokesman directed sexually crude and sexist tweets at women
item.description: The top spokesman for the Department of Health and Human Services repeatedly directed crude and sexist comments toward women in now-deleted tweets, a CNN KFile review finds.

item.title: Reporter to Trump's new press secretary: Will you ever lie to us?
item.description: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany tells reporters at her first press briefing that she will never lie to the press.

item.title: In quest for vaccine, US makes 'big bet' on company with unproven technology
item.description: It almost felt like an episode of "Shark Tank."

item.title: EU chief denies disinformation report was watered down for China
item.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen has denied allegations that the EU watered down a report on coronavirus disinformation after being pressured from China.

item.title: This CEO is giving $1.6M he made in the stock market to his employees
item.description: Larry Connor, CEO of the Connor Group, made a lot of money on the stock market in just 8 days. He's giving it all away to about 400 employees.

item.title: Comparing Covid-19 to the flu is not fair
Michael Jordan was offered $100M to appear at an event for two hours. He said no, his agent says
Covid-19 cases on second US warship near 100 as Navy restricts information
item.description: Nearly 100 sailors from the US Navy destroyer USS Kidd have tested positive for coronavirus, two US defense officials told CNN Friday.

item.title: What we can learn from South Korea about containing Covid-19
item.description: What can the world learn from South Korea, considered by health experts to be one of the few countries that did most things right in containing the spread of coronavirus? CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

item.title: The Earth is losing ice at a record speed, new study finds
item.description: The Earth is losing ice at a record speed chiefly due to warming from the ocean caused by climate change.

item.title: Police shoot and kill man suspected of stabbing seven people in Australia
item.description: A man suspected of stabbing at least seven people in and around a mall in Western Australia has been shot dead by police.

item.title: Table for one? Pop-up restaurant to serve solo diners only
item.description: The cost of a three-course meal at Bord For En (Table For One), a pop-up restaurant in Sweden opening May 10, is left to the diner's discretion.

item.title: Tesla stock tanks after Musk tweets price is 'too high'
item.description: Tesla's stock price dropped sharply Friday, minutes after CEO Elon Musk tweeted "Tesla stock price is too high, IMO."

item.title: Russia said virus was under control. See startling images that emerged.
item.description: Startling images from a hospital in the south of Russia show how Covid-19 is overstretching its health service. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

item.title: Jeff Bezos called to testify before US Congress
item.description: House lawmakers are demanding that Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos testify before Congress, threatening to subpoena the world's richest man following a report last week that the company allegedly uses sales data from third-party sellers on its platform to gain a competitive advantage against them.

item.title: Will Ferrell crashed Seattle Seahawks Zoom call
item.description: In a pandemic-free world, the Seattle Seahawks would be gearing up for training camp and playing in person.

item.title: Bill Gates says US system produces 'bogus' testing numbers
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Dr. Sanjay Gupta talk to Bill Gates on the fight against coronavirus.

item.title: Flamingos flock to a locked-down Mumbai
item.description: The humans may be in lockdown in India, but tens of thousands of flamingos are making the most of the peace and quiet.

item.title: Drummer and Afrobeat pioneer dead at 79
item.description: Nigerian drummer Tony Allen, co-creator of Afrobeat, died at the age of 79 on Thursday, his manager has told CNN.

item.title: We're all glued to our screens right now. Here's how you can protect your eyes.
Watch hilarious talking dog meme about quarantine
item.description: Dog-owners go gaga over their pets while in quarantine. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports they're social but not distancing.

item.title: Rarely seen photos from the Met Gala show celebrities letting loose
item.description: The first Monday of May this year marks an absence in the fashion world. With the cancellation of the Met Gala and the indefinite closure of the Metropolitan Museum of Art due to the coronavirus pandemic, the museum's front steps will remain quiet, empty of the usual crowds of celebrities and fashion insiders who flock to the annual fundraiser for the Costume Institute.

item.title: All that sourdough you've been making could help scientists
item.description: By the end of this pandemic, we'll all have one thing in common -- at some point during our isolation, we attempted to make sourdough.

item.title: 'Parks and Rec' reunion channeled all of us in quarantine
item.description: The cast members of NBC's hit sitcom "Parks and Recreation" came together for a special reunion show in hopes of raising money for Feeding America.

item.title: Why the pressure to change our faces has never been higher
item.description: For her sprawling history "Face: A Visual Odyssey," designer and author Jessica Helfand assembled a dazzling cabinet of human curiosities. From police mugshots and dating-site selfies, to politicians' headshots, Victorian death portraits and rubberised sex-dolls -- all to grapple with the way our faces have been presented and judged over the centuries -- and the lengths we've gone to, to "improve" them.

item.title: What's in store for the cruise industry?
item.description: When travelers come aboard the Zaandam, a cruise ship in the Holland America Line, they have access to nine levels of elegant lodgings, entertainment and fine dining.

item.title: Is this the end of cheap air travel?
item.description: Alexandre de Juniac of the International Air Transport Association (IATA) says the coronavirus pandemic will end the days of cheap flights.

item.title: 20 years ago, a virus emerged in Asia and spread across the world, infecting millions of computers. ILOVEYOU is still one of the largest cyberattacks on record
item.description: Wearing a striped shirt and Matrix-style dark glasses, Onel de Guzman stared at the floor as he made his way through a crowd of photographers into a hastily arranged press conference in Quezon City, a suburb of the Philippines capital Manila.

item.title: White House blocks Fauci from testifying next week
How the A380 superjumbo dream fell apart
item.description: • 'Tsunami' of airline job losses has begun

item.title: Singapore to begin to loosen restrictions
How did Australia flatten its coronavirus curve?
item.description: • This country reported its first virus case the same day as the US. It now has its outbreak under control

item.title: Critics liken Covid-19 to the flu. Why that's not a fair comparison
item.description: • US makes 'big bet' on company with unproven technology in vaccine quest
